title: Thunderbird is marking all Hotmail emails as read.
content: This problem appeared about a week ago. All of my emails in the Hotmail folder were marked as read. After searching online and trying some of the solutions (I do not have Bitdefender), I finally turned off automatic marking as read. However, when I marked the email I was reading in the preview pane, all the emails before and after it were marked as read. Even weirder, after manually marking a group of emails as unread, after a while, I sat and watched those emails get marked as read (un-bold) and then marked as unread again (bold). So, at this point, I have no viable solution.
creator: Thespian

title: message sending in TB
content: I'm relatively new to TB. In Windows Live Mail, I could write a message and hit send, which then put it in the outbox. Then, but only then, I could either manually send the message (send and receive) or have the program do so automatically every x minutes. In TB, when I hit send, it simply sends the message. Is there a way to store messages in the outbox until I'm ready for them to be sent? Do I need to go offline and then back online to do that? If so, I assume that means that when I'm offline, I can't receive any messages. If there are messages in the outbox and I go online, do they get sent when I hit "get messages?"
creator: jsg11

title: Can't send or receive emails
content:
Hi Suddenly my email doesn't work.

Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.earthscapes.com.au failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.
creator: janeawickers

title: Email for contact marked as not junk keep moving email to spam folder
content:
Dear All,

I have a a sender that his email address is from same email domain with mine. Initially was able to receive messages from his side without any issues. Last week I observed that all messages received from this sender move to spam folder. I have already marked sender as not junk, add sender address to my personal address book and supposedly Thunderbird will not mark message as junk if is in your personal address book, I have also reset Junk training data. However although sender emails marked as not junk and moved to inbox after short time return to spam folder. Is it something that I am missing? FYI I have already search for a solution but nothing worked. Thanks in advance.
creator: mastoras1969

title: Messages download repeatedly when I add a Gmail-hosted address as a new IMAP account
content:
I’m a new user, using Thunderbird v. 115.13.0 (64-bit), running under Windows 10. If you can help me with the following problem, I’ll be grateful.

I added three already-existing Gmail accounts to Thunderbird using IMAP, and everything was working fine. But when a week later I added a fourth account (once again with IMAP) -- not a gmail.com account this time, but one hosted by Gmail -- Thunderbird did strange things with the downloading of all the messages. It seemed at first to be working fine: downloading first all the message headers, then the messages in the Inbox, then those in the All Mail folder and in various other folders. I began using the new account, and everything seemed good.

But later on it started downloading all the Inbox messages again (only for this new account), but this time progressively more slowly. In fact, it slowed Thunderbird down so much that it became unusable.

I quit Thunderbird and restarted, but that didn’t help: It began once again to download inbox messages, very slowly, making Thunderbird once again unusably slow.

At this point I deleted the new account (including all the message data), then added it once again. But I ran into the same problem.

The Inbox in Gmail has about 37,000 messages, and the All Mail folder, about 47,000. There are no messages in the Trash.

Thanks very much for any help you can give me.

All the best, Alan
creator: aheubert1

title: Network errors cause filters to be disabled and the target rule deleted
content:
I've discovered that network errors cause filters to be disabled and the target rule deleted. This has caused me to have to go edit dozens of rules to get filters working again.

I have seen this with two scenarios: 1. Expired certificate on my mail server 2. Flaky (as in really flaky) WiFi in the hotel I am currently staying in

Both of these are a big problem. Network errors should not cause problems with filter definitions and deleting the targets is a really bad idea. I'm okay with having to rerun the filters, but not having to spend minutes to hours repairing the filter rules.
creator: technoronin

title: Thunderbird elimina correos antiguos
content: Buenos días Tengo una incidencia con Thunderbird. La cuestión es que Thunderbird elimina automáticamente los correos de mi bandeja de entrada, cuando llevan más de 3 semanas aproximadamente. Este borrado automático no se produce en el caso de las subcarpetas, ahí se conservan. Tengo dos cuentas de correo en Thunderbird y en los dos casos pasa lo mismo. El problema es siempre en la bandeja de entrada principal. En la configuración de las cuentas, en sincronización y almacenamiento, tengo marcada la opción "conservar los mensajes en todas las carpetas..." Tampoco me aparece ningún problema de espacio en disco. Ruego me indiquen cómo corregir la incidencia.
creator: insulabarataria5

title: Global search doesn't work as it should.
content:
Dear Sir or Madam, I have already described my problem in the Thunderbird forum and in the Mozilla group chat. Unfortunately, nobody was able to help me. A senior forum member told me that this problem was known, but that nobody was looking into it. Now to my problem: According to their help pages for Thunderbird, you can search partial expressions and complete expressions in the global search. To do this, you put the complete expression in inverted commas. I have tried this several times with different expressions. Unfortunately, no matter whether with or without inverted commas, only the partial expression is searched for. Example: "D-Link" Thunderbird searches for Link and not for D-Link. I have also restarted the search indexing. Unfortunately without any improvement. So my question is: are you aware of the problem? If so, are you endeavouring to rectify the error? If so, when?

with kind regards Jürgen Huber
creator: butch.triathlet

title: Non invia messaggi.
content: Fino ad ora ha sempre funzionato adesso all'improvviso non invia piu messaggi. Le impostazioni in uscita sono esatte. I messaggi in entrata li riceve regolarmente Questo è l'allert che mi appare: Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Non è stato possibile inviare il messaggio perché la connessione al server in uscita (SMTP) sendm.cert.legalmail.it non è riuscita. Il server potrebbe non essere disponibile o rifiutare le connessioni in uscita (SMTP). Verificare che le impostazioni del server in uscita (SMTP) siano corrette e riprovare.
creator: avvterlimbacco

title: Abrir email
content: Al abrir un correo electrónico (ext. eml) con Thuderbird, se abre también una sesión del programa. En versiones anteriores del Thunderbird esto no sucedía, de forma que al abrir un email sólo veía el contenido del mismo, sin abrirse también el programa. ¿Cómo lo puedo solucionar? ¿Hay alguna opción para ello?
